sub_title: Environmental Engineer | Van Effen Scholar @TU Delft | Water
summary:
‣ About: 
I am an MSc Environmental Engineering student at TU Delft, Netherlands passionate about the design and development of water and wastewater treatment technologies. On the weekends you will find me volunteering for mentorship activities, reading a book, or hiking. I cherish challenging and unique experiences.  

‣ Language Skills: 
Learning Dutch A1

‣ Previous Experience: 
I worked full-time as a Project Engineer for ~1 year where I was responsible for the design, engineering, and commissioning of industrial water and wastewater treatment plants. I have interned at multiple startups during my under-graduation encompassing responsibilities such as secondary research, CAD design, product development, procurement, product planning, and team management. 

‣ Contact Info:
Email: sejaldangi98@gmail.com 

‣ Inspiration:
"We are all born with a divine fire in us. Our efforts should be to give wings to this fire and fill the world with the glow of its goodness."

treasury_media.title: Best Design Proposal Award - SPCE Robocon
treasury_media.description: During my time as Team Leader at SPCE Robocon, I led 36 students to participate in India's largest Robotics contest - DD Robocon India 2019. It was a 3 stage competition and our team ranked 1 in Stage 1 and Stage 2 of the contest. We ranked 9th out of 86 teams at the Final Event held at IIT Delhi.

projects.title: Feasibility of Powering Residential Households in Indian Cities through Solar Rooftop PV Installations - Case Study of Pune
projects.description: According to the National Solar Mission of the Government of India, 100 GW of solar is targeted for installation by 2030. Out of this, 40 GW is set aside for solar rooftop installations. To achieve this ambitious target and to assess whether these installations will meet the electrical requirements of Indian households, it is necessary to study the technical and economic feasibility of powering residential households in Indian cities using solar rooftop installations. To assess the same, the Pune Municipal Corporation is studied. In the first part of the study, the total solar insolation received by Pune per year is calculated. The monthly, seasonal and yearly tilt angles are documented and yearly tilt angle is used for further analysis. A collection of sample buildings is selected from each ward and the BFA ratio for each ward of Pune Municipal Corporation is calculated using satellite imagery from Google Earth Pro. The PVA ratio is derived from literature review and total area available for installations of solar panels within Pune is calculated using the two ratios. The total installation area and the calculated actual solar insolation are used to estimate the total number of electrical units produced by residential rooftop PV in Pune. It is concluded that solar rooftop installations can meet 25.47% of predicted residential electricity demand of Pune for the year 2020-2021. In order to promote residentials to adopt solar PV, one building is modelled to study the economic feasibility of rooftop plants. A CAPEX model for a rooftop PV system is developed for a sample twelve floor residential building. Design of solar module mounting structure is proposed and overall output for the building is calculated. It is concluded that the it will take nearly 4 years for a modern residential building of twelve floors to have returns on its investment.

profile_positions.description:
Project: Clariflocculator for Bifurcation of Drinking Water from Storm Water at RWTP TSK

‣ Led the design, supply, and commissioning of a 9.6 MLD raw water treatment for TATA Steel, a multi-national steel manufacturing giant. 
‣ Responsible for finalizing the pipe routing, piping and instrumentation diagrams, and hydraulic and process flow diagrams for the entire plant.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Project Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Project: Development of Effluent Treatment and Infrastructure Facility at Jhagadia Pumping Station, Ankleshwar, Gujarat

‣ Conducted technical review of bought-out items, including, but not limited to, pumps, filters, air blowers, lighting, and air conditioning systems for a 38 MLD wastewater treatment plant for Engineers India Limited
‣ Reviewed P&IDs, calculated chemical requirements and assisted with procurement activities
profile_positions.title: Trainee Engineer

company.name: Society for Innovation and Development, IISc

profile_positions.company: Foundation for Science, Innovation and Development, IISc Bangalore
profile_positions.description:
Project: Designing, Prototyping and Project Planning for a Portable Water Treatment Unit based on Electrocoagulation with application in disaster management

‣ Worked under the guidance of Prof. Sanjiv Sambandan at the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore to understand the feasibility of introducing a product line for his start-up Openwater.in aiming to make water treatment and wastewater management hassle-free.
‣ Conducted literature review on electrocoagulation technology to develop a detailed product design and production plan
‣ Conducted competitor benchmarking, developed target specifications and generated two concept designs for prototyping 
‣ Coordinated with vendors and manufacturers to develop prototypes for testing
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Project: Community Wastewater Treatment Plant Commissioning & Installation 

‣ Conducted research on optimum placement and mounting of sewage pump within underground water tank. Studied pump curves to iterate head vs RPM requirement
‣ Carried out product survey for submersible sewage pumps and underground water tanks 
‣ Designed an explanatory CATIA model of wastewater treatment plant installation site to serve as a visual aid for iterating site parameters
‣ Assisted in scenario building for retrofitting key process units such as raw and treated water sumps to optimize capacity of water sumps and electricity requirements
‣ Structured an exhaustive Bill of Quantities 
‣ Developed understanding of challenges faced in removal of nitrogen from wastewater 
‣ Studied multiple wastewater treatment technologies with their advantages, disadvantages and applications to assess their suitability depending on client requirements

Project: Business Development 

‣ Created a standard template for Business Proposals & Business Presentations 
‣ Developed comprehensive summaries of 'Advisory on on-site and off-site sewage management practices developed by Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs' & 'Schedule of Rates' documents to highlight business expansion opportunities
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Project: Business development for Ekam Eco Solutions (a research spin-off of IIT Delhi’s works on Sanitation) 

‣ Selected as Summer Research Fellow under the Summer Fellowship Research Programme by IIT Delhi 
‣ Assisted in Business Development through literature review on topics such as Home  Composting, Microgreens, Aquaponics,  Hydroponics & Urban  Farming and developed informational videos for the same
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Project: Coffee Table Book on Sanitation in India

‣ Conducted research to understand the challenges faced by various stakeholders such as rural and urban users, environmental planners, decision makers, women, children, real estate developers, rag pickers, and sewer line cleaners pertaining to the sanitation sector to develop a comprehensive understanding of the current state of sanitation/hygiene in India. 
‣ Managed a team of 6 to develop comic strips and content for a graphic coffee table book on Sanitation
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Project: Reducing user error in modelling Life Cycle Assessment Studies 

‣ Selected as Summer Research Fellow by Prof. B. Gurumoorthy under the Joint Summer Research Fellowship Programme 2019 offered by the Three Science Academies of India - INSA-NASI-IAS
‣ Designed observational experiments to study the usability of Life Cycle Assessment software openLCA and SimaPro using concepts from usability testing methods
‣ Assisted in developing an algorithm to reduce user effort and error in modelling Life Cycle studies
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Project : Design and Fabrication of Manual and Autonomous Robots for DD Robocon India, 2019

‣ Led and managed a team of 36 undergraduate engineering students to design and fabricate Manual and Autonomous Robots for national level robotics contest, DD Robocon India 2019 
‣ Designed a holonomic Manual Robot (pick and place with pneumatic catapult) and Welding Fixtures on CATIA V5 R20 under rule book constraints 
‣ Restructured the Project Timeline to suit the altered competition format (with respect to previous year)
‣ Created Technical Design Report and Video Submission Files for qualification through Stage 1 and Stage 2 of the competition 
‣ Designed Marketing Brochures, Business Pitch, Business Presentation using Microsoft PowerPoint and Adobe Photoshop 

Key Achievements : 
‣ Recipient of the Best Idea Proposal Award 
‣ AIR 9 for the Final stage of DD Robocon India, 2019
‣ Qualified Stage 1 and Stage 2 with AIR 1 (in first year of participation with the new competition format)
